articles.title: Kim Jong Il Enjoys Performance Given by Art Squad of KPA
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Enjoys Performance Given by Art Squad of KPA
Pyongyang, February 9 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il enjoyed together with soldiers a performance given by the art squad of Unit 963 of the KPA.
					 Its colorful performance included numbers like "DPRK in February," "Glory to Our Great Party", "Huichon News" and "We Will Always Protect the General with Our Own Lives".
					
					 When the performance was over, he acknowledged the enthusiastic cheers of the performers and audience and congratulated the artistes on their successful performance.
					
					 He expressed great satisfaction over the truthful and powerful performance staged by the members of the art squad with the numbers fully reflecting the inexhaustible mental power of the soldiers of the KPA. He highly appreciated their success in the presentation and extended thanks to them.
					
					 The members of the art squad are dynamically conducting political and economic agitation in the work sites for a great surge including the construction site of the Huichon Power Station, an outpost for building a thriving nation, as befitting the artistes of the revolutionary army, instilling the conviction of sure victory, optimism and the spirit and courage to wipe out the enemy into the soldiers, he said. He highly praised their revolutionary work style.
					
					 He set forth important tasks to serve as guidelines for all art squads of the country to intensify the performing activities as required by the Songun era.
					
					 Among the audience were Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the WPK, Kim Ki Nam and Choe Thae Bok, members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the C.C., the WPK, Kim Kyong Hui, member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK, and other senior officials of the Party and the army.

articles.title: Foreign Ministry Hosts Friendship Meeting
articles.content:
Foreign Ministry Hosts Friendship Meeting 
						
 Pyongyang, February 9 (KCNA) -- The Foreign Ministry of the DPRK hosted a friendship meeting with members of the missions of the international organizations in Pyongyang on Wednesday.
					 It was held on the occasion of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Present there on invitation were representatives of international organizations including Jerome Sauvage, U.N. resident coordinator in the DPRK, and members of the missions.
					
					 Vice-Minister Pak Kil Yon and other officials of the ministry were on hand.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 They talked about boosting cooperation between the DPRK and the international organizations.

articles.title: Reception Given by Cuban Ambassador
articles.content:
Reception Given by Cuban Ambassador
Pyongyang, February 9 (KCNA) -- A reception was hosted by Jose Manuel Galego Montano, Cuban ambassador to the DPRK, at his embassy Wednesday on the occasion of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Present there on invitation were Pak Ui Chun, minister of Foreign Affairs, Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade, Kim Yong Jin, chairman of the Education Commission, Kim Jong Suk, chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and other officials concerned.
					
					 The ambassador said in his speech that the heroic struggle of the Korean people for the building of a great prosperous and powerful socialist nation and the reunification of the country is unthinkable without the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Hoping that the exchange between the two countries would further expand in all fields, he stressed that the Cuban people would stand by the Korean people forever.
					
					 Pak Ui Chun in his speech referred to the fact that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries have steadily grown stronger.
					
					 He stressed that the WPK and the government of the DPRK would make every possible effort to boost the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries.

articles.title: Reception Given by Mongolian Ambassador
articles.content:
Reception Given by Mongolian Ambassador
Pyongyang, February 9 (KCNA) -- Sodovjamts Khurelbaatar, Mongolian ambassador to the DPRK, hosted a reception at his embassy on Wednesday. It was given on the occasions of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il and the lunar New Year.
					 Present there on invitation were Kim Yong Il, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, and its officials.
					
					 Staff members of the Mongolian embassy were on hand.
					
					 The ambassador in his speech expressed thanks to Kim Jong Il for having shown deep concern for the development of the bilateral friendly relations provided by President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 He hoped that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would develop in various fields.
					
					 Kim Yong Il said in his speech that the Korean people extend the highest glory and warm greetings to Kim Jong Il on the occasion of his birthday.
					
					 He reiterated the willingness to boost the bilateral friendly relations, which were provided and developed by Kim Il Sung, together with the Mongolian leaders of the preceding generation.

articles.title: Film Shows Open to Celebrate Kim Jong Il's Birthday
articles.content:
Film Shows Open to Celebrate Kim Jong Il's Birthday
Pyongyang, February 9 (KCNA) -- 10-day film shows opened in the DPRK to celebrate General Secretary Kim Jong Il's birthday.
					 To be screened at cinemas and cultural halls in Pyongyang and local areas are documentaries including "Care Shown to Make Their Lives Shine" and "Led by Great Brilliant Commander" and feature films including "Inheritance" and "White Gem".
					
					 A film show in Pyongyang was opened with due ceremony at the People's Palace of Culture Wednesday.
					
					 Present there were Yang Hyong Sop, Kang Nung Su, officials concerned, creators and artistes in the field of film and arts and working people in Pyongyang.
					
					 Hong Kwang Sun, chairman of the State Film Commission, made an opening address.
					
					 After the ceremony the participants watched feature film "Wave of Songgang" (parts one and two).
					
					 Similar film shows also opened in provinces on the same day.

articles.title: Sports Contest of Officials for Paektusan Prize Closes
articles.content:
Sports Contest of Officials for Paektusan Prize Closes
 Pyongyang, February 9 (KCNA) -- The 16th sports contest of officials of national institutions for Paektusan Prize closed on Wednesday. 
					It was opened on Jan. 24 to celebrate February 16, the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The officials competed in eleven events, divided into 4 groups. 
					
					 Finishing first in team standing were the State Planning Commission, the Mansudae Art Studio, the Overseas Construction Guidance Bureau and the Taesongsan Guidance Bureau.
					
					 In men's basketball games the first place was won by the Ministry of Railways, the Minju Joson, the Taesong Guidance Bureau and the Guidance Bureau of Mining and Machine-Building Industry. 
					
					 In women's basketball, the Ministry of Mining Industry, the Mansudae Art Studio and the Myohyang Guidance Bureau placed first.
					
					 In men's volleyball, the first place was taken by the Education Commission, the Kumsong Youth Publishing House, the Ponghwa Guidance Bureau and the Foreign Trade Bank of the DPRK. In women's volleyball the Central Bank, the Mansudae Art Studio, the Overseas Construction Guidance Bureau and the Bureau of Diplomatic Corps Affairs came first. 
					
					 A closing ceremony was held at the Pyongyang Indoor Stadium.
					
					 Present there were Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kang Nung Su, vice-premier of the Cabinet, officials concerned, officials and players of ministries and national institutions and working people in Pyongyang.

articles.title: Foreigners Enjoy Symphony Orchestra
articles.content:
Foreigners Enjoy Symphony Orchestra
						
Pyongyang, February 9 (KCNA) -- Officials in charge of the cultural and friendly relations of foreign embassies in the DPRK enjoyed a performance given by the State Symphony Orchestra at the Moranbong Theatre Wednesday. It was given on the occasion of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					The artistes in numbers praised the exploits of Kim Jong Il who ushered in the heyday of building a prosperous and powerful nation through his energetic forced march of field guidance for the people's happiness. 
					
					They also put on the stage world famous music.

articles.title: Foreigners Visit E-Library of Kim Il Sung University
articles.content:
Foreigners Visit E-Library of Kim Il Sung University 
 Pyongyang, February 9 (KCNA) -- Diplomatic envoys of various countries and representatives of the international organizations here visited the e-library of Kim Il Sung University Wednesday.
					The visit was made on the occasion of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's birthday.
					
					 The guests were briefed on the library which was built as the best educational and scientific information service center. They went round a reading hall, a computer education room and a remote lecture room, etc.
					
					 They made entries in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Meeting Held to Mark Kim Jong Il's Birthday
articles.content:
Meeting Held to Mark Kim Jong Il's Birthday
						
Pyongyang, February 9 (KCNA) -- Workers and members of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea (GFTUK) held a meeting in celebration of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il. It took place at the Central Hall of Workers on Wednesday.
					 Hyon Sang Ju, chairman of the Central Committee of the GFTUK, made a report to be followed by speeches.
					
					 They said that Kim Jong Il's birth in Mt. Paektu, sacred mountain of the revolution, as son of the legendary guerrillas was great fortune of the nation. It was also a historic event that guaranteed the bright prospect of human cause of independence, they added.
					
					 They said that he has firmly defended the sovereignty of the country and the nation under the uplifted banner of Songun and provided a springboard for building a thriving socialist nation with his energetic guidance. 
					
					 The revolutionary exploits of Kim Jong Il who brings earlier the rosy future by ushering in the new history of building a rich and powerful country will shine forever, they emphasized.
					
					 They called on all the people to make positive contribution to improving the people's standard of living and building a thriving nation by making a fresh leap forward under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Attending the meeting was Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birthday Celebrated
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birthday Celebrated
 Pyongyang, February 9 (KCNA) -- A performance was given by the Workers' Art Group of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea (GFTUK). It was given at the Central Hall of Workers Wednesday to celebrate General Secretary Kim Jong Il's birthday. 
					 The colorful performance included numbers like "We Celebrate", "February Is Spring" and "When We Are Led by General." 
					
					 The performers extended the greatest glory and the warmest congratulations to Kim Jong Il reflecting profound reverence of all the workers and trade union members. 
					
					 Among the audience were officials of the GFTUK and working people in Pyongyang.

articles.title: Schoolchildren from across Country Make Study Tour
articles.content:
Schoolchildren from across Country Make Study Tour
Pyongyang, February 9 (KCNA) -- Schoolchildren from across the country made a study tour of the secret camp in Mt. Paektu where there is the birthplace of General Secretary Kim Jong Il from Feb. 2 to 8.
					 During their tour they laid floral baskets and flowers before the statues of President Kim Il Sung in the revolutionary battle site in Pochonbo, on the shore of Lake Samji, in the Chongbong Bivouac and the mosaic portraying the three commanders of Mt. Paektu in the Mt. Paektu secret camp before paying tribute to them.
					
					 They looked round the command post where the President led the Pochonbo battle to victory, the then police substation and subcounty office of the Japanese imperialists and other places. 
					
					 During their study tour they had a meeting to hear impressions of anti-Japanese guerrillas' reminiscences read by them and contests of marchers in singing revolutionary songs, published flash news of their march and quiz, etc.
					
					 They visited Kim Jong Il's birthplace on Feb. 6.
					
					 Being briefed on the fact that Kim Jong Il was born in a simple log cabin and grew up to be a great revolutionary, they looked round the historic relics preserved there with good care.
					
					 They visited several places in Samjiyon Township including the Paektu Museum and the Samjiyon Schoolchildren's Palace.

articles.title: Song in Praise of WPK
articles.content:
Song in Praise of WPK
						
 Pyongyang, February 9 (KCNA) -- The song "Glory to Our Great Party" is now popular among the Korean people.
					 The song came out in 2010 to mark a historic conference of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and its 65th anniversary.
					
					 In the first stanza the song reflects the happiness of the Korean people living under the care of the WPK, which has built a socialist society centred on the popular mass.
					
					 In the second the song praises the WPK for guiding the people to display the dignity of the nation and bring prosperity to the country.
					
					 In the third it represents the WPK carrying forward the revolutionary cause started by President Kim Il Sung and leading the nation along the road of victory. It also mirrors the strong will of the Korean people to always remain faithful to the WPK's leadership.
					
					 In the refrain, the song shows the Korean people extending the highest glory, deep thanks and heartfelt congratulations to the great party.

articles.title: S. Korea Urged to Sincerely Respond to Proposal for Dialogue
articles.content:
S. Korea Urged to Sincerely Respond to Proposal for Dialogue
 Pyongyang, February 9 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the diplomatic chief of south Korea at talks held with the U.S. deputy secretary of State during the latter's south Korean junket asked for bringing up the issue of the DPRK's uranium enrichment for peaceful purposes for the discussion at the UNSC, claiming that they are "a violation of international norms".
					 In the meantime, the Human Rights Committee of south Korea published a "2011 working plan" which envisages the holding of an international seminar, false propaganda, etc., to tarnish the image of the DPRK under the pretext of improving the "human rights situation in the north" and requested a huge budget to finance them.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 The above-said unsavory confrontation moves going against the trend of the times are the ones aimed at keeping the north-south dialogue from making any progress and straining the situation.
					
					 It is intolerable to provoke the other party at a time when arrangements for the north-south dialogue are in the making.
					
					 The south Korean side persists in its nuclear and "human rights" rackets against the DPRK, sticking to its anti-reunification "policy towards the north" and taking a passive approach towards dialogue. 
					
					 All this makes the south Korean side's will to mend the relations with the DPRK skeptical.
					
					 The south Korean authorities' diplomacy to bring up the above-said issue for discussion at the UNSC in collusion with foreign forces would get them nowhere. On the contrary, this would only end up obstructing the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula and escalating the prevailing confrontation.
					
					 Groundless accusations against compatriots under the pretext of "human rights issue" and the like are little short of chilling the atmosphere of dialogue.
					
					 The south Korean authorities would be well advised to stop standing in the way of dialogue over "the human rights issue in the north," a fiction. They had better halt the ridiculous anti-DPRK burlesque and sincerely approach the dialogue.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for North-South Cooperation
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for North-South Cooperation 
 Pyongyang, February 9 (KCNA) -- North-south cooperation and exchange is the best way of removing the danger of war on the Korean Peninsula and achieving independent reunification and prosperity common to the nation by its concerted efforts, says Rodong Sinmun in a bylined article Wednesday. 
					 Brisk cooperation and exchange between the north and the south will thaw the frozen relations of confrontation and bring warm atmosphere of reconciliation, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The publication of the June 15 joint declaration turned the north-south relations of distrust and confrontation into those of "by Korean nation itself" for promoting reconciliation and unity and opened up the June 15 era of reunification. This proved that multilateral cooperation and exchange are the just way of developing the north-south relations and opening up a bright prospect for reunification and prosperity. 
					
					 Cooperation and exchange are not the work for the interest of one side. 
					
					 Consistent is the stand of the DPRK to drastically improve the north-south relations and achieve independent reunification, peace and prosperity by activating cooperation and exchange. 
					
					 There is no doubt that the north-south relations of distrust and confrontation will turn into those of genuine confidence, reconciliation and cooperation if the south Korean authorities positively respond to the patriotic call and measures of the DPRK. 
					
					 If they refuse cooperation with the north under the unreasonable conditions and pretence as now, out of narrow-mindedness, it will only deepen distrust and confrontation, much less repairing the north-south relations.  
					
					 The north and the south can surely bring peace to this land and build a reunified thriving nation if they join hands. If all the Koreans work hard to resume the tour of Mt. Kumgang and Kaesong and promote multilateral cooperation and exchange, they can bring so much earlier the peace and reunification of the country.

articles.title: Imperialists' Ideological and Cultural Poisoning Aims at Aggression
articles.content:
Imperialists' Ideological and Cultural Poisoning Aims at Aggression
 Pyongyang, February 9 (KCNA) -- The imperialists' ideological and cultural poisoning precedes aggression and plunder, domination and subjugation of other countries, Rodong Sinmun, a major newspaper in the DPRK, says in a bylined article Wednesday.
					 This is mainly aimed to spread corrupt bourgeois ideology and culture and capitalist lifestyle in anti-imperialist and independent countries, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 Through the ideological and cultural poisoning the imperialists seek to break the unity and cohesion in socialist states and harm the socialist way of life.
					
					 The imperialist ideology and culture are poison which undermines and degenerates the socialist and anti-imperialist and independent countries and makes people spiritual cripples.
					
					 The confrontation with the imperialists in the ideological and cultural front is a serious class struggle and stand-off of ideologies.
					
					 Revolutionaries should not make even a step backward in this struggle but stand firm against the imperialists' moves to make their ideology and culture pervade among people.
					
					 The Korean people's history for socialist construction is shining as a glorious one in which they firmly adhered to Juche-oriented ideology and culture and steadily strengthened its front by frustrating those moves.
					
					 The Korean people will always resolutely foil those reactionary moves of the imperialists and consolidate the politico-ideological position of Korean-style socialism.

articles.title: Koreans Overseas Celebrate Lunar New Year
articles.content:
Koreans Overseas Celebrate Lunar New Year
						
Pyongyang, February 9 (KCNA) -- Koreans in Uzbekistan had a lunar New Year celebration in Tashkent on February 3.
					 Present there were Koreans in Uzbekistan, the DPRK ambassador to Uzbekistan and his embassy officials.
					
					 A speaker there called on all the compatriots to get united and work hard for national reunification this year.
					
					 Then followed a performance by Korean artistes.

articles.title: Japanese Organization Supports Korea's Independent
articles.content:
Japanese Organization Supports Korea's Independent
 Pyongyang, February 9 (KCNA) -- It is our hope that the dialogue between the authorities of the north and the south will open without delay and the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea will be achieved as early as possible.
					 The Japan Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea said this in its statement on February 3.
					
					 The statement referred to the principles, programmes and proposals set forth by President Kim Il Sung for national reunification and the great unity of the nation.
					
					 It noted that the June 15 joint declaration confirmed the main idea of the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea and the great unity of the nation and ways for achieving them as the firm will of the north and the south. 
					
					 Pointing to the stand of the DPRK clarified in the recent joint statement of its government, political parties and organizations, the statement noted that this is an expression of the firm will of the DPRK to put an end to sufferings and sorrow resulting from the national division by implementing the joint declaration based on the three principles of national reunification.

articles.title: DPRK's Efforts for North-South Dialogue Supported
articles.content:
DPRK's Efforts for North-South Dialogue Supported 
 Pyongyang, February 9 (KCNA) -- The Northern Caucasian Regional Organization of the All-Union Communist Party of Bolsheviks of Russia on Jan. 31 posted on its internet homepage an article titled "DPRK's efforts for the north-south dialogue".
					 The article said that the sincere efforts of the DPRK have created on the Korean Peninsula the possibilities of defusing the situation inching close to the brink of war. 
					
					 Those forces which seek to pursue their selfish purposes through the escalation of tension and confrontation, however, are getting more cunning in their moves to obstruct the dialogue, the article noted, and went on:
					
					 In order to avoid the vicious cycle of increasing tension on the peninsula it is important not to miss the hard-won opportunity but to give momentum to the atmosphere of dialogue.
					
					 The nuclear issue on the peninsula was spawned entirely to the U.S.  threat of a nuclear war and hostile policy toward the DPRK and there should be, therefore, a modality of dialogue for eradicating its root cause.
					
					 The DPRK remains invariable in its stand to denuclearize the peninsula.
					
					 The International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions posted an appeal of the Central Committee of the Democratic Front for the Reunification of Korea to the entire Korean nation on its internet homepage on Feb. 2.

articles.title: Birthday of Kim Jong Il Observed Abroad
articles.content:
Birthday of Kim Jong Il Observed Abroad
Pyongyang, February 9 (KCNA) -- Meetings were held in Mexico and Romania on February 3 and 4 on the occasion of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Present there were personages of political and social circles and masses. DPRK ambassadors and their embassy officials in the relevant countries were present on invitation.
					
					 Jesus Antonio Carlos Hernandez, general secretary of the Central Committee of the People's Socialist Party of Mexico, said that     Kim Jong Il has wisely led the struggle of the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people to accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche started by President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 He expressed belief that the Korean people would achieve miraculous successes in the drive for building a thriving nation and achieving national reunification this year, too under the experienced and tested leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The secretary general of the Romania-Korea Friendship Association noted that Kim Jong Il enjoys undisputed trust and boundless reverence of not only the Korean people but progressive mankind as he has defended the sovereignty of the country and led the human cause of independence to victory with his Songun politics.
					
					 He extended full support and solidarity to the Korean people in their just cause of protecting the sovereignty and dignity of the country and the nation and the cause of socialism, building a thriving nation and achieving national reunification.
					
					 A message of greetings to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the meeting in Romania.

articles.title: Story of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Anecdote about Kim Jong Il's Care for Workers' Health
Pyongyang, February 9 (KCNA) -- It happened one day in June 2010 when General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave field guidance to the Namhung Youth Chemical Complex.
					 After looking round several places of the complex equipped with ultra-modern facilities, he told officials to guide him to the workers' dormitory. 
					
					 He looked at boiled rice, soup and various dishes on the table and said that there was too much salt in the worker's standard daily intake.
					
					 He said: "Whatever we do we should think first of the health of the workers. This is not the matter related to a few grams of salt.
					
					 Our workers are valuable treasures of the country as they devote themselves to it, single-mindedly following the party and thinking only of the interests of the revolution. No matter how much fertilizer is produced, they cannot substitute for the health of the workers."
					
					 The officials were deeply touched to hear his earnest advise that the richer the wealth for happiness grows, the higher spirit of service to the people the officials should cherish.

articles.title: Encuentro de amistad con extranjeros por 16 de febrero
articles.content:
Encuentro de amistad con extranjeros por 16 de febrero
Pyongyang, 9 de febrero (ATCC) -- Con motivo del dia de nacimiento del Dirigente Kim Jong Il el Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea ofrecio el dia 9 un encuentro de amistad con los miembros de las representaciones de organizaciones internacionales acreditadas en nuestro pais.
					Al acto fueron invitados Jerome Sauvage, coordinador permanente ante la ONU y otros representantes y miembros de las representaciones.
					
					Y estuvieron presentes el vicecanciller Pak Kil Yon y otros funcionarios de la cancilleria coreana.
					
					En la ocasion hubo discursos.
					
					Los participantes departieron sobre el desarrollo de las relaciones de cooperacion entre la RPDC y las organizaciones internacionales.

articles.title: Obreros y miembros de FGSC festejan el 16 de febrero
articles.content:
Obreros y miembros de FGSC festejan el 16 de febrero
						
Pyongyang, 9 de febrero (ATCC) -- Con motivo del 16 de febrero, dia de nacimiento del Dirigente     Kim Jong Il, tuvo lugar el dia 9 en la Casa Central de Obreros el acto conmemorativo de los obreros y los miembros de la Federacion General de los Sindicatos de Corea (FGSC).
					Tras el informe del presidente del Comite Central de la FGSC, Hyon Sang Ju, hubo discursos.
					
					Los oradores senalaron que el nacimiento del Dirigente como hijo de la guerrilla legendaria en el monte Paektu, el sagrado de la revolucion coreana, devino una gran fortuna de la nacion y un acontecimiento historico que prometio el porvenir de la causa de independencia de la humanidad.
					
					Se refirieron a que bajo la bandera del Songun, el Dirigente defendio firmemente la soberania del pais y la nacion y realizo sin parar la orientacion sobre el terreno para preparar la plataforma de salto hacia la gran potencia prospera socialista.
					
					Se transmitiran eternamente las proezas revolucionarias del Dirigente, quien abre una nueva historia de construccion de la patria prospera y adelanta el futuro maravilloso, destacaron.
					
					Exhortaron a todo el pueblo coreano a producir un nuevo salto en acato a la guia del Dirigente sobre la revolucion mediante el Songun para contribuir de verdad a la mejora de la vida del pueblo y a la construccion de la gran potencia prospera.
					
					En la ocasion estuvo presente Choe Ryong Hae, secretario del CC del Partido del Trabajo de Corea.

articles.title: Embajador cubano ofrece banquete por el 16 de febrero
articles.content:
Embajador cubano ofrece banquete por el 16 de febrero
Pyongyang, 9 de febrero (ATCC) -- Con motivo del dia de natalicio del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, el embajador de la republica  de Cuba en Corea, Jose Manuel Galego Montano, ofrecio el dia 9 un banquete en su sede diplomatica.
					A la recepcion fueron invitados el canciller Pak Ui Chun, el  ministro de Comercio Exterior Ri Ryong Nam, el presidente del Comite de Educacion, Kim Yong Jin, la presidenta del Comite de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero, Kim Jong Suk, y otros funcionarios coreanos.
					
					Al hacer uso de la palabra, el embajador cubano dijo que, al margen de la sabia orientacion del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, no se puede pensar en la lucha heroica del pueblo coreano por la construccion de la gran potencia prospera socialista y la reunificacion de la patria.
					
					Manifesto el deseo de que el intercambio entre ambos paises se amplie en todos los dominios y subrayo que en el futuro tambien, el pueblo coreano estara siempre junto con el pueblo coreano.
					
					Por su parte, Pak Ui Chun se refirio a que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises se consolidan incesantemente.
					
					Enfatizo que el PTC y el gobierno de la RPDC haran ingentes esfuerzos por desarrollar las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion Corea-Cuba.

articles.title: Embajador mongol ofrece banquete con motivo de fiestas coreanas
articles.content:
Embajador mongol ofrece banquete con motivo de fiestas coreanas
Pyongyang, 9 de febrero (ATCC) -- Con motivo del cumpleanos del Dirigente Kim Jong Il y el Ano Nuevo Lunar, el embajador mongol en Corea, Sodovjamts Khurelbaatar, ofrecio el dia 9 un banquete en su sede diplomatica.
					A la ocasion fueron invitados el secretario Kim Yong Il y otros funcionarios del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea.
					
					Y estuvieron presentes los miembros de la embajada mongola.
					
					Al hacer uso de la palabra, Sodovjamts Khurelbaatar agradecio profunda atencion que presta siempre Su Excelencia Kim Jong Il al desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad entre Mongolia y la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, preparadas por Su Excelencia Kim Il Sung.
					
					Deseo que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre ambos paises se amplien y se desarrollen en varios dominios.
					
					A su vez, Kim Yong Il dijo que el pueblo coreano rinde la maxima gloria y cordial saludo al Dirigente en ocasion de la fiesta de febrero.
					
					Destaco la necesidad de desarrollar mas las relaciones de amistad Corea-Mongolia, establecidas y desarrolladas por el Presidente Kim Il Sung junto con los lideres antecesores de Mongolia.

articles.title: Inaugurado el ciclo de cine en Corea
articles.content:
Inaugurado el ciclo de cine en Corea
						
Pyongyang, 9 de febrero (ATCC) -- Quedo inaugurado el dia 9 en el Palacio Cultural del Pueblo el ciclo de cine en homenaje al dia de nacimiento del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					  En la ceremonia inaugural participaron Yang Hyong Sop, Kang Nung Su y otros funcionarios, los creadores y artistas de la rama cinematografica y trabajadores capitalinos.
					
					  Durante el ciclo se proyectaran en los cines y las casas culturales de esta capital y otras localidades del pais los documentales "Regazo de brillante vida", "Teniendo al gran General" y las peliculas de ficcion "Herencia", "Gema blanca", etc.
					
					  El discurso de apertura estuvo a cargo de Hong Kwang Sun, presidente del Comite Estatal de Cine.
					
					  Terminada la ceremonia inaugural, los participantes vieron la pelicula de ficcion "Oleaje de Songgang" (primera y segunda partes).
					
					  El mismo dia, el ciclo fue iniciado tambien en las provincias.

articles.title: Clausurada XVI competencia deportiva por Copa Paektusan
articles.content:
Clausurada XVI competencia deportiva por Copa Paektusan
Pyongyang, 9 de febrero (ATCC) -- Quedo clausurada este miercoles en el Palacio de Deportes de Pyongyang la XVI competencia deportiva de los funcionarios de organos centrales por la Copa Paektusan que fue iniciada el 24 de enero con motivo del cumpleanos  del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					En este evento, los deportistas jugaron en 11 disciplinas divididos en 4 grupos.
					
					El Comite Estatal de Planificacion, la Casa de Creacion Mansudae, la Direccion de Construccion en el Extranjero y la Direccion Taesongsan ocuparon primeros lugares en la clasificacion general de los respectivos grupos.
					
					El Ministerio del Ferrocarril, la Editora del Periodico Minju Joson, la Direccion Taesong, la Direccion de Industria de Maquinas Extractivas salieron ganadores de la competencia de baloncesto masculino y el Ministerio de Industria Extractiva, la Casa de Creacion Mansudae y la Direccion Myohyang, en el baloncesto femenino.
					
					Por otra parte, ocuparon primeros puestos en el voleibol masculino el Comite de Educacion, la Editorial de la Juventud Kumsong, la Direccion Ponghwa y el Banco Comercial, y en el voleibol femenino, el Banco Central, la Casa de Creacion Mansudae, la Direccion de Construccion en el Extranjero y la Direccion de Servicio al Cuerpo Diplomatico.
					
					Estuvieron presentes en la ceremonia de clausura el secretario del Comite Central del PTC, Choe Ryong Hae, el vicepremier del Consejo de Ministros Kang Nung Su, y otros funcionarios, los funcionarios y jugadores de los ministerios y organos centrales junto con trabajadores capitalinos.
